texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: 1) Self-Image ↔ Target Role Alignment
texts.text: 1) Self-Image ↔ Target Role Alignment

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: Definition & Scope
texts.text: Definition & Scope

texts.label: text
texts.orig: How closely your current professional self-image (what you believe you are good at, how you describe yourself, what you routinely do) matches the next role you want. Scope includes your narrative (bio, headline), behaviors (projects you choose, time allocation), artifacts (CV, portfolio, LinkedIn), and signals (language, metrics you highlight). It excludes compensation negotiations and company-specific interview mechanics.
texts.text: How closely your current professional self-image (what you believe you are good at, how you describe yourself, what you routinely do) matches the next role you want. Scope includes your narrative (bio, headline), behaviors (projects you choose, time allocation), artifacts (CV, portfolio, LinkedIn), and signals (language, metrics you highlight). It excludes compensation negotiations and company-specific interview mechanics.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: Rationale & Impact
texts.text: Rationale & Impact

texts.label: text
texts.orig: Alignment reduces 'identity friction'-the gap between intent and signal-that quietly kills momentum. When aligned, you pick better projects, practice the right skills, tell coherent stories, and attract the right opportunities; when misaligned, you scatter effort, confuse reviewers, and stall.
texts.text: Alignment reduces 'identity friction'-the gap between intent and signal-that quietly kills momentum. When aligned, you pick better projects, practice the right skills, tell coherent stories, and attract the right opportunities; when misaligned, you scatter effort, confuse reviewers, and stall.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · Hiring clarity: Clear fit signals → higher screen/shortlist rates.
texts.text: Hiring clarity: Clear fit signals → higher screen/shortlist rates.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · Preparation efficiency: Practice time maps to actual job tasks.
texts.text: Preparation efficiency: Practice time maps to actual job tasks.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · Motivation & resilience: Identity-consistent goals are stickier.
texts.text: Motivation & resilience: Identity-consistent goals are stickier.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · Network pull: Mentors and referrers recognize your 'lane' faster.
texts.text: Network pull: Mentors and referrers recognize your 'lane' faster.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: If Fully misaligned
texts.text: If Fully misaligned

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · Reset the target: Write a one-paragraph role spec (problems solved, users, stack/tools, success metrics).
texts.text: Reset the target: Write a one-paragraph role spec (problems solved, users, stack/tools, success metrics).

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · Identity rewrite: Draft a 1-sentence identity: 'I am a {role} who {business outcome} using {tooling/domain}.' Put it atop CV/LinkedIn.
texts.text: Identity rewrite: Draft a 1-sentence identity: 'I am a {role} who {business outcome} using {tooling/domain}.' Put it atop CV/LinkedIn.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · Artifact purge & rebuild: Remove off-track keywords/projects; add a 2-project roadmap that mirrors dayin-the-life tasks of the role.
texts.text: Artifact purge & rebuild: Remove off-track keywords/projects; add a 2-project roadmap that mirrors dayin-the-life tasks of the role.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · Environment design: Block 5-10 hrs/week for role tasks; follow 3 experts; join 1 community; schedule weekly shadowing or code-along.
texts.text: Environment design: Block 5-10 hrs/week for role tasks; follow 3 experts; join 1 community; schedule weekly shadowing or code-along.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · Proof loop (weekly): Plan → Do (a micro-deliverable) → Publish (post/readme) → Feedback (mentor rubric) → Adjust.
texts.text: Proof loop (weekly): Plan → Do (a micro-deliverable) → Publish (post/readme) → Feedback (mentor rubric) → Adjust.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: If Partially aligned
texts.text: If Partially aligned

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · Narrow the lane: Choose one domain (e.g., 'fraud risk' vs generic data). Update headline to 'Aspiring {role} | {domain}'.
texts.text: Narrow the lane: Choose one domain (e.g., 'fraud risk' vs generic data). Update headline to 'Aspiring {role} | {domain}'.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · Bridge projects (2-4 weeks each): Ship two mini case studies with business metric, method, outcome, and tradeoffs.
texts.text: Bridge projects (2-4 weeks each): Ship two mini case studies with business metric, method, outcome, and tradeoffs.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · Vocabulary sync: Mirror the job's verbs and artifacts (e.g., 'runbook, SLA, DAG, A/B uplift') in your bullets and posts.
texts.text: Vocabulary sync: Mirror the job's verbs and artifacts (e.g., 'runbook, SLA, DAG, A/B uplift') in your bullets and posts.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · Signal consistency: Align resume bullets, LinkedIn About, and top repo readme to the same story and metrics.
texts.text: Signal consistency: Align resume bullets, LinkedIn About, and top repo readme to the same story and metrics.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: If Mostly aligned
texts.text: If Mostly aligned

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · Last-mile gap closure: Identify 2 missing 'must-have' experiences; simulate them (sandbox repo, mock ticket, or pro bono task).
texts.text: Last-mile gap closure: Identify 2 missing 'must-have' experiences; simulate them (sandbox repo, mock ticket, or pro bono task).

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · Outcome emphasis: Redraft bullets to show baseline → intervention → measurable delta (%, time saved, $ impact).
texts.text: Outcome emphasis: Redraft bullets to show baseline → intervention → measurable delta (%, time saved, $ impact).

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · Interview narrative polish: Build 6-8 STAR/METRIC stories mapped to the role competencies; rehearse weekly with timed drills.
texts.text: Interview narrative polish: Build 6-8 STAR/METRIC stories mapped to the role competencies; rehearse weekly with timed drills.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · External validation: Secure 2 endorsements/references that echo your target narrative.
texts.text: External validation: Secure 2 endorsements/references that echo your target narrative.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: If Fully aligned
texts.text: If Fully aligned

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · Scale your signal: Publish a monthly deep-dive; give a lightning talk; contribute to an open template/tool used in the role.
texts.text: Scale your signal: Publish a monthly deep-dive; give a lightning talk; contribute to an open template/tool used in the role.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · Teach/mentor: Run a study circle or code review club-teaching reinforces identity and broadens referrals.
texts.text: Teach/mentor: Run a study circle or code review club-teaching reinforces identity and broadens referrals.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · Opportunity funnel: Maintain a live pipeline: roles tracked, referrals requested, artifacts tailored; review conversion monthly.
texts.text: Opportunity funnel: Maintain a live pipeline: roles tracked, referrals requested, artifacts tailored; review conversion monthly.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · Drift guardrails: Quarterly audit of time spent vs role tasks; prune activities that don't serve the next step.
texts.text: Drift guardrails: Quarterly audit of time spent vs role tasks; prune activities that don't serve the next step.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: Success Metrics & Signals
texts.text: Success Metrics & Signals

texts.label: text
texts.orig: Track a mix of leading (skill/signal) and lagging (outcome) indicators.
texts.text: Track a mix of leading (skill/signal) and lagging (outcome) indicators.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · Leading indicators
texts.text: Leading indicators

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: o Asset Alignment Score (0-4): Resume, LinkedIn, top repo, and last project each match the role's problems, tools, and metrics. Target ≥3.5.
texts.text: o Asset Alignment Score (0-4): Resume, LinkedIn, top repo, and last project each match the role's problems, tools, and metrics. Target ≥3.5.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: o Time Allocation Ratio: ≥70% of weekly learning/build time on role-specific tasks.
texts.text: o Time Allocation Ratio: ≥70% of weekly learning/build time on role-specific tasks.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: o Vocabulary Match Rate: In your top artifacts, ≥80% of keywords mirror 3 target JDs.
texts.text: o Vocabulary Match Rate: In your top artifacts, ≥80% of keywords mirror 3 target JDs.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: o Shipping Cadence: ≥2 role-relevant artifacts/month (case studies, PRs, notebooks, demos).
texts.text: o Shipping Cadence: ≥2 role-relevant artifacts/month (case studies, PRs, notebooks, demos).

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: o Mentor/Rubric Score: ≥4/5 on a role-competency rubric across 2 reviewers.
texts.text: o Mentor/Rubric Score: ≥4/5 on a role-competency rubric across 2 reviewers.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: · Lagging indicators
texts.text: · Lagging indicators

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: o Screen → Interview rate: % of applications yielding interviews; aim for ≥25% with referrals, ≥10% cold.
texts.text: o Screen → Interview rate: % of applications yielding interviews; aim for ≥25% with referrals, ≥10% cold.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: o Interview pass-through: Progression across stages; target sequential ≥30% per stage.
texts.text: o Interview pass-through: Progression across stages; target sequential ≥30% per stage.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: o Warm referrals: ≥2 per month from practitioners in the target role.
texts.text: o Warm referrals: ≥2 per month from practitioners in the target role.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: o Stretch opportunities: Count of role-like tasks assigned at work/school; target upward trend.
texts.text: o Stretch opportunities: Count of role-like tasks assigned at work/school; target upward trend.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: · Qualitative signals
texts.text: · Qualitative signals

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: o Recruiter messages explicitly naming your target role.
texts.text: o Recruiter messages explicitly naming your target role.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: o Feedback paraphrases your identity sentence.
texts.text: o Feedback paraphrases your identity sentence.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: o You naturally choose projects and language consistent with the role without prompting.
texts.text: o You naturally choose projects and language consistent with the role without prompting.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: Capability Gaps → Precise Fixes
texts.text: Capability Gaps → Precise Fixes

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: Definition & Scope
texts.text: Definition & Scope

texts.label: text
texts.orig: This insight classifies the specific types of gaps that slow your progress toward the next role, so you can pick the right theory, practice, and resources . Scope covers six categories: Foundational knowledge, Tools proficiency, Mental models/frameworks, Domain knowledge, Communication & collaboration, Decision heuristics. It focuses on practical, trainable skills and excludes company-specific bureaucracy or compensation topics.
texts.text: This insight classifies the specific types of gaps that slow your progress toward the next role, so you can pick the right theory, practice, and resources . Scope covers six categories: Foundational knowledge, Tools proficiency, Mental models/frameworks, Domain knowledge, Communication & collaboration, Decision heuristics. It focuses on practical, trainable skills and excludes company-specific bureaucracy or compensation topics.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: Rationale & Impact
texts.text: Rationale & Impact

texts.label: text
texts.orig: Labeling the right gap type prevents 'spray-and-pray' learning. When you know what kind of gap you have, you choose better resources, practice the correct tasks, and improve faster.
texts.text: Labeling the right gap type prevents 'spray-and-pray' learning. When you know what kind of gap you have, you choose better resources, practice the correct tasks, and improve faster.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · Resource fit: You study the concept/tool/model that fixes the bottleneck (not everything).
texts.text: Resource fit: You study the concept/tool/model that fixes the bottleneck (not everything).

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · Faster pass-through: Interview and on-job tasks map directly to the repaired skill.
texts.text: Faster pass-through: Interview and on-job tasks map directly to the repaired skill.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · Better compounding: Clear gaps → focused reps → measurable gains you can showcase.
texts.text: Better compounding: Clear gaps → focused reps → measurable gains you can showcase.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · Team trust: Communication and decision quality rise when the underlying gap is fixed.
texts.text: Team trust: Communication and decision quality rise when the underlying gap is fixed.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: 1) Foundational knowledge
texts.text: 1) Foundational knowledge

texts.label: text
texts.orig: Signals: You can do recipes but stumble on 'why'; confuse terms (variance vs bias); fragile under novel questions.
texts.text: Signals: You can do recipes but stumble on 'why'; confuse terms (variance vs bias); fragile under novel questions.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · Quick wins (≤2 weeks):
texts.text: Quick wins (≤2 weeks):

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: o Build a concept map of 20-30 core ideas (definitions + 1-line example).
texts.text: o Build a concept map of 20-30 core ideas (definitions + 1-line example).

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: o Do 30 mins/day spaced retrieval (flashcards; explain-out-loud rule).
texts.text: o Do 30 mins/day spaced retrieval (flashcards; explain-out-loud rule).

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · Foundations (1-3 months):
texts.text: Foundations (1-3 months):

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: o Work through one canonical text/course end-to-end; solve chapter problems by hand.
texts.text: o Work through one canonical text/course end-to-end; solve chapter problems by hand.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: o Write 'explain like I'm 12' notes for 10 core topics.
texts.text: o Write 'explain like I'm 12' notes for 10 core topics.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · Stretch (3-6 months):
texts.text: Stretch (3-6 months):

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: o Teach a mini-workshop or publish explainer posts ; field questions.
texts.text: o Teach a mini-workshop or publish explainer posts ; field questions.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · Practice loop: Plan (topic set) → Do (problems) → Check (self-quiz) → Fix (gap notes) → Teach (post).
texts.text: Practice loop: Plan (topic set) → Do (problems) → Check (self-quiz) → Fix (gap notes) → Teach (post).

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · Resources: Core textbook, high-quality MOOC, spaced-repetition app, problem sets.
texts.text: Resources: Core textbook, high-quality MOOC, spaced-repetition app, problem sets.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: 2) Tools proficiency
texts.text: 2) Tools proficiency

texts.label: text
texts.orig: Signals: Slow IDE/SQL/notebook work; copy-paste from StackOverflow; stuck on environment errors; missed shortcuts.
texts.text: Signals: Slow IDE/SQL/notebook work; copy-paste from StackOverflow; stuck on environment errors; missed shortcuts.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · Quick wins (≤2 weeks):
texts.text: Quick wins (≤2 weeks):

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: o Pick one tool and complete a task ladder (10 tiny tasks → 1 mini project).
texts.text: o Pick one tool and complete a task ladder (10 tiny tasks → 1 mini project).

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: o Learn 15 shortcuts/macros; set a one-command dev env script.
texts.text: o Learn 15 shortcuts/macros; set a one-command dev env script.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · Foundations (1-3 months):
texts.text: Foundations (1-3 months):

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: o Build two reproducible projects (clean repo, README, makefile, tests).
texts.text: o Build two reproducible projects (clean repo, README, makefile, tests).

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: o Pair once/week with a stronger peer; keep a snippets library .
texts.text: o Pair once/week with a stronger peer; keep a snippets library .

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · Stretch (3-6 months):
texts.text: Stretch (3-6 months):

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: o Contribute a small plugin/PR or automate a recurring workflow at work.
texts.text: o Contribute a small plugin/PR or automate a recurring workflow at work.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · Practice loop: Plan (workflow) → Timebox → Record blockers → Write mini-fix → Repeat.
texts.text: Practice loop: Plan (workflow) → Timebox → Record blockers → Write mini-fix → Repeat.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · Resources: Official docs, tutorial repo with tests, keyboard-shortcut cheatsheet, pair-programming.
texts.text: Resources: Official docs, tutorial repo with tests, keyboard-shortcut cheatsheet, pair-programming.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: 3) Mental models / frameworks
texts.text: 3) Mental models / frameworks

texts.label: text
texts.orig: Signals: You jump to solutions; weak problem framing; can't structure trade-offs; answers meander in interviews.
texts.text: Signals: You jump to solutions; weak problem framing; can't structure trade-offs; answers meander in interviews.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · Quick wins (≤2 weeks):
texts.text: Quick wins (≤2 weeks):

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: o Adopt one framework per task type (e.g., STAR for stories; OODA for debugging; ICE/RICE for prioritization).
texts.text: o Adopt one framework per task type (e.g., STAR for stories; OODA for debugging; ICE/RICE for prioritization).

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: o Create 3 checklists (problem framing, experiment design, post-mortems).
texts.text: o Create 3 checklists (problem framing, experiment design, post-mortems).

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · Foundations (1-3 months):
texts.text: Foundations (1-3 months):

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: o Write decision memos weekly (Problem → Options → Criteria → Choice → Risks).
texts.text: o Write decision memos weekly (Problem → Options → Criteria → Choice → Risks).

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: o Rehearse 8 core interview stories mapped to competencies.
texts.text: o Rehearse 8 core interview stories mapped to competencies.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · Stretch (3-6 months):
texts.text: Stretch (3-6 months):

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: o Facilitate a design review or retro using your framework; iterate from feedback.
texts.text: o Facilitate a design review or retro using your framework; iterate from feedback.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · Practice loop: Pick framework → Apply on real task → Compare vs checklist → Adjust.
texts.text: Practice loop: Pick framework → Apply on real task → Compare vs checklist → Adjust.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · Resources: Framework handbooks, decision-journal template, interview story bank.
texts.text: Resources: Framework handbooks, decision-journal template, interview story bank.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: 4) Domain knowledge
texts.text: 4) Domain knowledge

texts.label: text
texts.orig: Signals: You know the math/code but not the business , users, or constraints; metrics chosen don't match reality.
texts.text: Signals: You know the math/code but not the business , users, or constraints; metrics chosen don't match reality.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · Quick wins (≤2 weeks):
texts.text: Quick wins (≤2 weeks):

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: o Read 5 domain primers and 3 public post-mortems/case studies .
texts.text: o Read 5 domain primers and 3 public post-mortems/case studies .

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: o Build a domain glossary (20-40 terms) with examples.
texts.text: o Build a domain glossary (20-40 terms) with examples.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · Foundations (1-3 months):
texts.text: Foundations (1-3 months):

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: o Rework a prior project as a domain case (define users, KPI, constraints, baselines).
texts.text: o Rework a prior project as a domain case (define users, KPI, constraints, baselines).

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: o Interview 2-3 practitioners; shadow a relevant workflow if possible.
texts.text: o Interview 2-3 practitioners; shadow a relevant workflow if possible.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · Stretch (3-6 months):
texts.text: Stretch (3-6 months):

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: o Ship a mini product/analysis that moves a real domain metric (even pro bono).
texts.text: o Ship a mini product/analysis that moves a real domain metric (even pro bono).

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · Practice loop: Research → Model the system → Build small artifact → Get domain feedback → Iterate.
texts.text: Practice loop: Research → Model the system → Build small artifact → Get domain feedback → Iterate.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · Resources: Industry reports, internal wiki/PRDs, expert interviews, domain Slack/communities.
texts.text: Resources: Industry reports, internal wiki/PRDs, expert interviews, domain Slack/communities.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: 5) Communication & collaboration skills
texts.text: 5) Communication & collaboration skills

texts.label: text
texts.orig: Signals: Reviewers say 'unclear/too long'; PRs bounce; meeting time overruns; conflict lingers; stakeholders disengage.
texts.text: Signals: Reviewers say 'unclear/too long'; PRs bounce; meeting time overruns; conflict lingers; stakeholders disengage.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · Quick wins (≤2 weeks):
texts.text: Quick wins (≤2 weeks):

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: o Use BLUF (Bottom Line Up Front) in emails/updates; one-slide message discipline.
texts.text: o Use BLUF (Bottom Line Up Front) in emails/updates; one-slide message discipline.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: o Practice listen → summarize → confirm in meetings; timeboxed agendas.
texts.text: o Practice listen → summarize → confirm in meetings; timeboxed agendas.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · Foundations (1-3 months):
texts.text: Foundations (1-3 months):

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: o Weekly demo cadence ; adopt a status template (Goal → Progress → Blockers → Next).
texts.text: o Weekly demo cadence ; adopt a status template (Goal → Progress → Blockers → Next).

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: o Role-play feedback and negotiation; learn non-violent communication basics.
texts.text: o Role-play feedback and negotiation; learn non-violent communication basics.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · Stretch (3-6 months):
texts.text: Stretch (3-6 months):

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: o Lead a cross-function task; resolve one conflict to a written agreement.
texts.text: o Lead a cross-function task; resolve one conflict to a written agreement.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · Practice loop: Draft → Deliver → Record/observe → Collect notes → Adjust phrasing/structure.
texts.text: Practice loop: Draft → Deliver → Record/observe → Collect notes → Adjust phrasing/structure.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · Resources: Writing guides (BLUF, Pyramid Principle), meeting facilitation playbook, feedback scripts.
texts.text: Resources: Writing guides (BLUF, Pyramid Principle), meeting facilitation playbook, feedback scripts.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: 6) Decision heuristics
texts.text: 6) Decision heuristics

texts.label: text
texts.orig: Signals: Analysis paralysis; inconsistent choices; scope creep; 'we'll see' instead of clear calls; regrets postdecision.
texts.text: Signals: Analysis paralysis; inconsistent choices; scope creep; 'we'll see' instead of clear calls; regrets postdecision.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · Quick wins (≤2 weeks):
texts.text: Quick wins (≤2 weeks):

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: o Adopt default heuristics : Max expected value , Reversible? Decide fast , If blocked, run a 48-hour spike .
texts.text: o Adopt default heuristics : Max expected value , Reversible? Decide fast , If blocked, run a 48-hour spike .

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: o Set guardrails : timebox decisions; define 'stop rules' (what evidence ends the search).
texts.text: o Set guardrails : timebox decisions; define 'stop rules' (what evidence ends the search).

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · Foundations (1-3 months):
texts.text: Foundations (1-3 months):

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: o Keep a decision journal (Context → Options → Criteria → Chosen → Predicted outcome). Review monthly.
texts.text: o Keep a decision journal (Context → Options → Criteria → Chosen → Predicted outcome). Review monthly.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: o Practice premortems and postmortems on key calls.
texts.text: o Practice premortems and postmortems on key calls.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · Stretch (3-6 months):
texts.text: Stretch (3-6 months):

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: o Build a playbook of 10 recurring decisions with pre-agreed heuristics for your team.
texts.text: o Build a playbook of 10 recurring decisions with pre-agreed heuristics for your team.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · Practice loop: Decide → Log → Review later vs outcome → Update heuristic.
texts.text: Practice loop: Decide → Log → Review later vs outcome → Update heuristic.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · Resources: Decision-making books/notes, premortem templates, simple scoring/ranking sheets.
texts.text: Resources: Decision-making books/notes, premortem templates, simple scoring/ranking sheets.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: Success Metrics & Signals
texts.text: Success Metrics & Signals

texts.label: text
texts.orig: Use leading (skill signals), lagging (outcomes), and qualitative markers. Set a 6-8 week target per selected gap. Leading indicators (weekly)
texts.text: Use leading (skill signals), lagging (outcomes), and qualitative markers. Set a 6-8 week target per selected gap. Leading indicators (weekly)

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · Foundations: quiz accuracy ≥80% on targeted concepts; 2+ topics added to concept map; 3+ spacedrepetition sessions.
texts.text: Foundations: quiz accuracy ≥80% on targeted concepts; 2+ topics added to concept map; 3+ spacedrepetition sessions.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · Tools: time-to-complete standard task ↓ 30-50%; zero 'environment drift' incidents; 2 repo utilities added.
texts.text: Tools: time-to-complete standard task ↓ 30-50%; zero 'environment drift' incidents; 2 repo utilities added.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · Mental models: each major task attaches a chosen framework; 1 decision memo/week; 6-8 refined interview stories.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: Definition & Scope
texts.text: Definition & Scope

texts.label: text
texts.orig: How frequently choice overload or analysis paralysis keeps you from committing to a clear path. This covers personal decisions that affect skill-building and career momentum (e.g., which course, project, stack, role focus), and the mechanisms to reduce friction : defaults, timeboxes, heuristics, and small experiments. It excludes external blockers (e.g., waiting on approvals) unless they trigger your indecision.
texts.text: How frequently choice overload or analysis paralysis keeps you from committing to a clear path. This covers personal decisions that affect skill-building and career momentum (e.g., which course, project, stack, role focus), and the mechanisms to reduce friction : defaults, timeboxes, heuristics, and small experiments. It excludes external blockers (e.g., waiting on approvals) unless they trigger your indecision.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: Rationale & Impact
texts.text: Rationale & Impact

texts.label: text
texts.orig: Stalls silently burn cycles. Without commitment, you scatter effort, miss compounding practice, and signal uncertainty to reviewers and teammates. A lightweight choice architecture -defaults, decision thresholds, and reversible tests-shrinks decision latency, concentrates reps on the right path, and raises throughput (more finished artifacts, clearer narrative). Net effect: faster skill growth, stronger portfolio coherence, and better interview passthrough.
texts.text: Stalls silently burn cycles. Without commitment, you scatter effort, miss compounding practice, and signal uncertainty to reviewers and teammates. A lightweight choice architecture -defaults, decision thresholds, and reversible tests-shrinks decision latency, concentrates reps on the right path, and raises throughput (more finished artifacts, clearer narrative). Net effect: faster skill growth, stronger portfolio coherence, and better interview passthrough.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: If you answered Never
texts.text: If you answered Never

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · Guard against overconfidence: Add a post-decision check (Did we define success? Did we ignore key risks?).
texts.text: Guard against overconfidence: Add a post-decision check (Did we define success? Did we ignore key risks?).

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · Tiny safety rails: Keep a reversible vs. irreversible check; sleep on irreversible calls ≥24h.
texts.text: Tiny safety rails: Keep a reversible vs. irreversible check; sleep on irreversible calls ≥24h.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · Calibration: Maintain a decision journal (choice, criteria, predicted outcome). Review monthly for blind spots.
texts.text: Calibration: Maintain a decision journal (choice, criteria, predicted outcome). Review monthly for blind spots.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: If you answered Rarely
texts.text: If you answered Rarely

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · Light defaults: Pre-pick a default stack/course/path you follow unless new evidence surpasses a threshold.
texts.text: Light defaults: Pre-pick a default stack/course/path you follow unless new evidence surpasses a threshold.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · Timeboxing: Give routine choices 15-30 min , then decide; log what information would've changed the call.
texts.text: Timeboxing: Give routine choices 15-30 min , then decide; log what information would've changed the call.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · Short 'spikes': When unsure, run a 48-hour experiment (prototype, mini-module) then commit.
texts.text: Short 'spikes': When unsure, run a 48-hour experiment (prototype, mini-module) then commit.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: If you answered Sometimes
texts.text: If you answered Sometimes

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · Two-good-options rule: Narrow to max 2 viable options; write a 1-page decision memo (Problem → Options → Criteria → Choice → Risks).
texts.text: Two-good-options rule: Narrow to max 2 viable options; write a 1-page decision memo (Problem → Options → Criteria → Choice → Risks).

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · Decision thresholds: Define 'good enough' (e.g., meets 3/5 must-haves). Decide when threshold is met.
texts.text: Decision thresholds: Define 'good enough' (e.g., meets 3/5 must-haves). Decide when threshold is met.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · Reversibility bias: If reversible, decide fast and test; if not, extend research by a fixed window (e.g., +48h) then commit.
texts.text: Reversibility bias: If reversible, decide fast and test; if not, extend research by a fixed window (e.g., +48h) then commit.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · Premortem & stop-rules: List how the choice could fail; set stop conditions that trigger a pivot.
texts.text: Premortem & stop-rules: List how the choice could fail; set stop conditions that trigger a pivot.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: If you answered Often
texts.text: If you answered Often

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · WIP limits: Cap yourself at 1 active path per skill stream (e.g., 1 course, 1 project); park others on a backlog.
texts.text: WIP limits: Cap yourself at 1 active path per skill stream (e.g., 1 course, 1 project); park others on a backlog.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · Commitment device: Make a public two-week commitment (scope, deliverables, demo date).
texts.text: Commitment device: Make a public two-week commitment (scope, deliverables, demo date).

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · Defaults with override: 'If undecided by Friday 5pm, follow default A.' Overrides require a brief memo.
texts.text: Defaults with override: 'If undecided by Friday 5pm, follow default A.' Overrides require a brief memo.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · Weekly decision block: Calendar a 60-min slot to clear queued choices using a scorecard (criteria 1-5).
texts.text: Weekly decision block: Calendar a 60-min slot to clear queued choices using a scorecard (criteria 1-5).

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · Mentor checkpoint: Review the memo + scorecard with a peer for fast external validation.
texts.text: Mentor checkpoint: Review the memo + scorecard with a peer for fast external validation.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: If you answered Almost always
texts.text: If you answered Almost always

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · Option freeze: Reduce to two options; ban new inputs until after a 7-day test.
texts.text: Option freeze: Reduce to two options; ban new inputs until after a 7-day test.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · Algorithmic choice: Use a simple scoring model (weight criteria, auto-pick winner); commit to the algorithm's result.
texts.text: Algorithmic choice: Use a simple scoring model (weight criteria, auto-pick winner); commit to the algorithm's result.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · Minimum Viable Decision (MVD): Define the smallest, 1-week commitment that tests the core assumption; ship it before revisiting.
texts.text: Minimum Viable Decision (MVD): Define the smallest, 1-week commitment that tests the core assumption; ship it before revisiting.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · Environment design: Remove rabbit holes (limit tabs/resources); enforce deadline + default combo.
texts.text: Environment design: Remove rabbit holes (limit tabs/resources); enforce deadline + default combo.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · Support: If stalls stem from stress/burnout, add rest blocks and, if needed, speak with a mentor/coach to rebuild decision confidence.
texts.text: Support: If stalls stem from stress/burnout, add rest blocks and, if needed, speak with a mentor/coach to rebuild decision confidence.

texts.label: text
texts.orig: Universal practice loop: Decide → Log (criteria, reversibility, expected outcome) → Act (timeboxed test) → Review vs reality → Update heuristic.
texts.text: Universal practice loop: Decide → Log (criteria, reversibility, expected outcome) → Act (timeboxed test) → Review vs reality → Update heuristic.

texts.label: text
texts.orig: This insight checks whether you've assembled the essential parts of a learn → practice → feedback engine for your target role. Scope includes five components that turn effort into compounding skill: Curriculum/sequence, Weekly plan, Milestones/rubrics, Feedback channel, Reflection log. It focuses on personal upskilling and portfolio-building workflows, not employer-specific processes or compensation topics.

texts.label: text
texts.orig: When any link in the loop is missing, progress stalls: you study the wrong things (no curriculum), drift week-to-week (no plan), can't tell if 'done' is good (no rubric), improve slowly (no feedback), and repeat mistakes (no reflection). Completing the loop:
texts.text: When any link in the loop is missing, progress stalls: you study the wrong things (no curriculum), drift week-to-week (no plan), can't tell if 'done' is good (no rubric), improve slowly (no feedback), and repeat mistakes (no reflection). Completing the loop:

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: Definition & Scope
texts.text: Definition & Scope

texts.label: text
texts.orig: This insight identifies the process bottlenecks that create waste and cognitive load in your learn → build → ship loop. Scope includes seven categories you can directly influence: Unclear SOPs, Context switching, Tool fragmentation, Rework/redo, Waiting on others, Lack of templates, Other (custom). It focuses on lightweight operational fixes (clarity, sequencing, guardrails, automation), not on compensation or org politics.
texts.text: This insight identifies the process bottlenecks that create waste and cognitive load in your learn → build → ship loop. Scope includes seven categories you can directly influence: Unclear SOPs, Context switching, Tool fragmentation, Rework/redo, Waiting on others, Lack of templates, Other (custom). It focuses on lightweight operational fixes (clarity, sequencing, guardrails, automation), not on compensation or org politics.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: Rationale & Impact
texts.text: Rationale & Impact

texts.label: text
texts.orig: Unremoved bottlenecks turn effort into thrash: starts without finishes, shallow focus, and work that bounces in review. Targeted process interventions shorten cycle time , reduce error/rework , and protect deep work , which compounds into more shipped artifacts, cleaner interviews (you can explain your system), and steadier momentum.
texts.text: Unremoved bottlenecks turn effort into thrash: starts without finishes, shallow focus, and work that bounces in review. Targeted process interventions shorten cycle time , reduce error/rework , and protect deep work , which compounds into more shipped artifacts, cleaner interviews (you can explain your system), and steadier momentum.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: Unclear SOPs (Standard Operating Procedures)
texts.text: Unclear SOPs (Standard Operating Procedures)

texts.label: text
texts.orig: Signals: 'How do we do this again?', inconsistent outputs, repeated DM questions.
texts.text: Signals: 'How do we do this again?', inconsistent outputs, repeated DM questions.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · Quick wins: One-page SOP card per recurring task: Owner · Trigger · Inputs · 5-9 steps · Definition of Done · Checklist . Pin it in the repo.
texts.text: Quick wins: One-page SOP card per recurring task: Owner · Trigger · Inputs · 5-9 steps · Definition of Done · Checklist . Pin it in the repo.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · Foundations: Convert to versioned runbooks with examples; add Definition of Ready/Done to tickets; create RACI for approvals.
texts.text: Foundations: Convert to versioned runbooks with examples; add Definition of Ready/Done to tickets; create RACI for approvals.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · Stretch: Automate steps (scripts/CI), add quality gates (lint/tests), run quarterly SOP audits .
texts.text: Stretch: Automate steps (scripts/CI), add quality gates (lint/tests), run quarterly SOP audits .

texts.label: text

texts.label: list_item

texts.text: Quick wins: WIP ≤1 per stream; 90-min deep-work blocks ; mute noncritical alerts; batch comms twice/day; 'parking lot' note for ideas.

texts.label: list_item

texts.orig: · Stretch: Meeting-light days for makers; team-wide focus hours; quarterly calendar purge.

texts.text: Tool Fragmentation

texts.label: text
texts.orig: This insight identifies the study modalities that stick best for you so we can weight resources and schedules toward what actually drives retention and transfer. Scope includes seven modesReading, Videos, Audio/podcasts, Hands-on practice, Teaching/explaining, Visual diagrams, Worked examples -and how to combine them by learning stage (first-pass understanding → retention → performance). It excludes time/availability constraints and employer-specific training rules.

texts.label: text
texts.orig: How new ideas should be introduced to you so they 'click' fast and stick. We're choosing a sequencing strategy -the order and framing used at first contact-so your brain has the best entry point. Covered modes: Big picture → details , Concrete example → principle , Step-by-step from basics , Compare/contrast with what you already know . This focuses on first-pass learning and early reinforcement; it doesn't prescribe deep specialization paths or employer-specific training.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: Definition & Scope
texts.text: Definition & Scope

texts.label: text
texts.orig: Your problem-solving posture is the default mode you bring to tasks: either generating many possibilities ( divergent ), narrowing to a single best option ( convergent ), or balancing both deliberately. Scope covers how you approach research, solution design, modeling, debugging, road-mapping, and feedback sessions. It includes the rituals, constraints, and cues that help you pick (and switch) modes. It excludes company politics and resourcing decisions outside your control.
texts.text: Your problem-solving posture is the default mode you bring to tasks: either generating many possibilities ( divergent ), narrowing to a single best option ( convergent ), or balancing both deliberately. Scope covers how you approach research, solution design, modeling, debugging, road-mapping, and feedback sessions. It includes the rituals, constraints, and cues that help you pick (and switch) modes. It excludes company politics and resourcing decisions outside your control.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: Rationale & Impact
texts.text: Rationale & Impact

texts.label: text
texts.orig: Using the wrong mode at the wrong time is costly: premature convergence kills good ideas; endless divergence prevents shipping. Choosing the right posture reduces waste , lowers cognitive load , and improves quality .
texts.text: Using the wrong mode at the wrong time is costly: premature convergence kills good ideas; endless divergence prevents shipping. Choosing the right posture reduces waste , lowers cognitive load , and improves quality .

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · Speed: Clear mode → fewer loops, faster decision latency.
texts.text: Speed: Clear mode → fewer loops, faster decision latency.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · Quality: Divergence surfaces non-obvious options; convergence raises rigor and fit.
texts.text: Quality: Divergence surfaces non-obvious options; convergence raises rigor and fit.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · Team alignment: Mode-matched feedback prevents 'drive-by' criticism and review churn.
texts.text: Team alignment: Mode-matched feedback prevents 'drive-by' criticism and review churn.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · Motivation: Structured progress (explore → decide → execute) sustains momentum.
texts.text: Motivation: Structured progress (explore → decide → execute) sustains momentum.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: Definition & Scope
texts.text: Definition & Scope

texts.label: text
texts.orig: When you hit an impasse -code won't run, analysis won't converge, design won't click-this insight selects the first intervention most likely to break inertia. It standardizes five options for the learn → build → ship loop: Search docs/examples, Restate/simplify the problem, Sketch a diagram, Compare to a prior pattern, Ask for a targeted hint. Scope covers individual work (coding, analytics, research, writing) and lightweight team requests (PRs, reviews). It excludes non-work blockers (e.g., approvals, access) unless they're the root cause.

Scope covers individual work (coding, analytics, research, writing) and lightweight team requests (PRs, reviews). It excludes non-work blockers (e.g., approvals, access) unless they're the root cause.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: Definition & Scope
texts.text: Definition & Scope

texts.label: text
texts.orig: This insight identifies the practical constraints that most often block your weekly learn → build → ship rhythm so we can right-size workload, add scaffolds, and design recovery . Scope includes seven constraint types you can influence: Low energy/fatigue, Stress/overload, Environment/noise, Competing obligations, Health concerns, Irregular schedule, Other (custom) . It focuses on habits, scheduling, ergonomics, and lightweight policy changesnot clinical treatment or organizational politics.
texts.text: This insight identifies the practical constraints that most often block your weekly learn → build → ship rhythm so we can right-size workload, add scaffolds, and design recovery . Scope includes seven constraint types you can influence: Low energy/fatigue, Stress/overload, Environment/noise, Competing obligations, Health concerns, Irregular schedule, Other (custom) . It focuses on habits, scheduling, ergonomics, and lightweight policy changesnot clinical treatment or organizational politics.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: Rationale & Impact
texts.text: Rationale & Impact

texts.label: text
texts.orig: Consistency compounds. If a hidden constraint keeps breaking your streak, you never get enough reps for skills to stick. Making the constraint explicit lets you re-plan capacity , add the right guardrails (templates, WIP limits, buffers), and protect deep work . Result: steadier throughput, lower rework, and a portfolio that grows every week instead of in bursts.
texts.text: Consistency compounds. If a hidden constraint keeps breaking your streak, you never get enough reps for skills to stick. Making the constraint explicit lets you re-plan capacity , add the right guardrails (templates, WIP limits, buffers), and protect deep work . Result: steadier throughput, lower rework, and a portfolio that grows every week instead of in bursts.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: Definition & Scope
texts.text: Definition & Scope

texts.label: text
texts.orig: How often you skipped planned practice in the last 4 weeks. 'Planned' means a session you slotted in your calendar/weekly plan; 'skipped' means you didn't do it and didn't reschedule it within 48 hours . Scope includes study blocks, drills, coding katas, and project work aimed at your target role. It excludes sessions you intentionally canceled and replaced with an equivalent block in the same week.
texts.text: How often you skipped planned practice in the last 4 weeks. 'Planned' means a session you slotted in your calendar/weekly plan; 'skipped' means you didn't do it and didn't reschedule it within 48 hours . Scope includes study blocks, drills, coding katas, and project work aimed at your target role. It excludes sessions you intentionally canceled and replaced with an equivalent block in the same week.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: Rationale & Impact
texts.text: Rationale & Impact

texts.label: text
texts.orig: Consistency compounds skills. Skips break spacing, slow feedback loops, and weaken motivation. Measuring your real skip rate lets us dial accountability to the right level -from light touch (self-led) to high structure (buddy, daily check-ins, tiny tasks). Done well, you'll see:

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: Definition & Scope
texts.text: Definition & Scope

texts.label: text
texts.orig: This insight captures the real-world constraints that shape your next 4-8 weeks so we can plan inside the box and still make progress. Scope includes six constraint types: Limited time, Budget cap, Tool/platform access, Network access, Location/logistics, Other (custom) . We turn each constraint into explicit bounds (hours, cost, access, mobility) and resource-savvy tactics (substitutions, batching, offline-first, mocks) that protect momentum.
texts.text: This insight captures the real-world constraints that shape your next 4-8 weeks so we can plan inside the box and still make progress. Scope includes six constraint types: Limited time, Budget cap, Tool/platform access, Network access, Location/logistics, Other (custom) . We turn each constraint into explicit bounds (hours, cost, access, mobility) and resource-savvy tactics (substitutions, batching, offline-first, mocks) that protect momentum.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: Rationale & Impact
texts.text: Rationale & Impact

texts.label: text
texts.orig: Unstated constraints lead to fantasy plans, missed milestones, and burnout. Stating the bounds early lets us rightsize workload, choose cheaper equivalents, and design offline/low-friction paths. Benefits:
texts.text: Unstated constraints lead to fantasy plans, missed milestones, and burnout. Stating the bounds early lets us rightsize workload, choose cheaper equivalents, and design offline/low-friction paths. Benefits:

texts.orig: Fear-Avoidance of Stretch Work → Exposure & Safety Plan
texts.text: Fear-Avoidance of Stretch Work → Exposure & Safety Plan

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: Definition & Scope
texts.text: Definition & Scope

texts.label: text
texts.orig: How frequently you avoid stretch opportunities (presenting, owning a complex task, interviewing, publishing work) because of fear of being 'found out.' The insight tunes an exposure plan (gradual, repeatable attempts) and safety scaffolds (guardrails that limit downside) so you can act despite discomfort. Scope includes volunteering, demos, interviews, high-visibility tickets, and learn-in-public posts. It excludes sensible 'no's' due to misalignment (wrong domain, unethical work, impossible deadline).
texts.text: How frequently you avoid stretch opportunities (presenting, owning a complex task, interviewing, publishing work) because of fear of being 'found out.' The insight tunes an exposure plan (gradual, repeatable attempts) and safety scaffolds (guardrails that limit downside) so you can act despite discomfort. Scope includes volunteering, demos, interviews, high-visibility tickets, and learn-in-public posts. It excludes sensible 'no's' due to misalignment (wrong domain, unethical work, impossible deadline).

texts.label: text
texts.orig: Note: If fear produces severe distress (panic, persistent insomnia, clinical anxiety), consider speaking to a qualified professional; the tactics below are non-clinical skill habits.
texts.text: Note: If fear produces severe distress (panic, persistent insomnia, clinical anxiety), consider speaking to a qualified professional; the tactics below are non-clinical skill habits.
